sense.name: academic test
sense.commentary: FINAL[+event] The last exam that is administered in an academic term.
sense.examples: I studied all night for my Linguistics final. It's almost finals time. The final begins at noon and ends at six-thirty. John failed his final because he'd been studying the wrong subject.

sense.name: last round in a tournament
sense.commentary: FINAL[+event] In an elimination tournament, the match between the winners of all the previous matches. The game or match that finalists play.
sense.examples: Our team made it to the finals! The final is going to be played on Saturday at ten o'clock in the morning. We lost the final and went home.

sense.name: physical test
sense.commentary: The actual exam, as a piece of paper, that students write on at the end of an academic term. Use this sense only when it is very clear that a physical object is being referred to.
sense.examples: John spilled coffee all over his final.
